docs.title: Primora Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the official documentation hub for the Primora programming language.

  • Dictionary
  • Book
  • Guides & Tutorials

Start learning Primora today!

docs.title: Primora Language Dictionary
docs.text: Welcome to the definitive dictionary of Primora! Here you'll find every keyword, concept, and idiom explained with examples.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Keywords
  • Operators
  • Types
  • Built-in Functions
  • Standard Library
  • Idioms

docs.title: Keywords
docs.text: Keyword Description Example if Conditional branching if (x > 0) { ... } else Alternate branch else { ... } plot Plot a variable plot x as "Title" echo Print to output echo "Hello" summarize Summarize a variable summarize text as summary fetch Fetch data from a URL fetch url("https://...") as data search Search for information search "query" as result ... ... ...

docs.title: Operators
docs.text: Operator Description Example + Addition a + b - Subtraction a - b * Multiplication a * b / Division a / b ... ... ...

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Type Description Example int Integer x = 42 float Floating point y = 3.14 string Text string name = "Primora" ... ... ...

docs.title: Built-in Functions
docs.text: Function Description Example translate() Translate text translate "hello" to "fr" summarize() Summarize text summarize text as summary ... ... ...

docs.title: Standard Library
docs.text: Primora comes with a rich standard library for data, AI, web, and more. See the book for details.

docs.title: Idioms
docs.text:
• Chained Operations: a = b + c * d
  • Conditional Assignment: if (x > 0) { y = 1 } else { y = -1 }
  • Data Fetching: fetch url("https://api") as data

For more, see the Primora Book and Guides.

docs.title: The Primora Programming Language Book
docs.text: Welcome to the official book for learning Primora! This book covers everything from the basics to advanced AI-powered programming.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Introduction
  • Getting Started
  • Language Basics
  • AI Features
  • Web Programming
  • Data Science
  • Advanced Topics
  • Appendix

Start with Introduction or jump to a topic of interest.

For quick reference, see the Dictionary or Guides.

docs.title: Advanced Topics in Primora
docs.text: Explore advanced features, patterns, and integrations.

docs.title: Custom Functions
docs.text:
def square(x) {
    return x * x
}
echo square(5)

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
try {
    risky_code()
} catch (e) {
    echo "Error: " + e
}

docs.title: Extending Primora
docs.text:
• Integrate with Python modules
  • Add custom AI models

Next: Appendix or Dictionary

docs.title: AI Features in Primora
docs.text: Primora makes AI easy and accessible. Use built-in features for summarization, translation, prediction, and more.

docs.title: Summarization
docs.text:
summarize text as summary
echo summary

docs.title: Translation
docs.text:
translate "hello" to "fr" as french_hello
echo french_hello

docs.title: Prediction
docs.text:
predict y from x using model("linear_regression") as prediction
echo prediction

docs.title: Search
docs.text:
search "What is the capital of France?" as answer
echo answer

Next: Web Programming or Dictionary

docs.title: Primora Syntax Reference
docs.text:
• Variable assignment: x = 1
  • Function definition: def foo() { ... }
  • Conditionals: if (cond) { ... } else { ... }
  • Loops: for x in list { ... }
  • Comments: # comment

docs.title: Built-in Functions
docs.text: • echo, plot, summarize, translate, fetch, search, predict, email, automate

docs.title: Reserved Words
docs.text:
• if, else, def, return, try, catch, for, in, ...

For full details, see the Dictionary.

docs.title: Data Science in Primora
docs.text: Primora makes data analysis and visualization simple.

docs.title: Plotting
docs.text: plot data as "Data Distribution"

docs.title: Summarization
docs.text:
summarize data as summary
echo summary

docs.title: Prediction
docs.text:
predict y from x using model("linear_regression") as prediction
plot prediction as "Prediction"

Next: Advanced Topics or Dictionary

docs.title: Getting Started with Primora
docs.text: This guide will help you set up your Primora environment and write your first program.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Primora can be run in the browser playground or locally.

docs.title: Browser Playground
docs.text:
• Visit Primora Playground
  • No installation required!

docs.title: Local Installation
docs.text:
• Clone the Primora repo from GitHub
  • Install Python 3.9+
  • Install dependencies: pip install -r requirements.txt
  • Run the backend: python primora_backend.py
  • Open the frontend in your browser

docs.title: Your First Primora Program
docs.text:
x = 5
y = x * 2
echo "The result is: " + y

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Explore Language Basics
  • Try the Guides

docs.title: Primora: Introduction
docs.text: Welcome to Primora, the next-generation programming language designed for AI, automation, and rapid application development. This introduction will give you an overview of what Primora is, why it was created, and how it empowers you to build intelligent applications with ease.

docs.title: What is Primora?
docs.text: Primora is a high-level, human-friendly language that blends traditional programming with AI-powered features. It is designed to be expressive, concise, and capable of integrating advanced AI and data science workflows out of the box.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Natural language-inspired syntax
  • Built-in AI functions (summarization, translation, prediction, etc.)
  • Data science and visualization tools
  • Web and automation capabilities
  • Extensible and open-source

docs.title: Who is Primora for?
docs.text:
• Beginners who want to learn programming quickly
  • Data scientists and AI practitioners
  • Web developers
  • Automation engineers
  • Educators and students

Continue to Getting Started or explore the Dictionary.

docs.title: Language Basics
docs.text: Learn the core syntax and semantics of Primora.

docs.title: Variables
docs.text:
x = 10
y = "hello"

docs.title: Data Types
docs.text: • int, float, string, bool, list, dict

docs.title: Operators
docs.text:
• Arithmetic: +, -, *, /, %
  • Comparison: ==, !=, >, <, >=, <=
  • Logical: and, or, not

docs.title: Control Flow
docs.text:
if (x > 0) {
    echo "Positive"
} else {
    echo "Non-positive"
}

docs.title: Functions
docs.text:
def add(a, b) {
    return a + b
}
result = add(2, 3)

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
# This is a comment

Continue to AI Features or revisit the Dictionary.

docs.title: Web Programming with Primora
docs.text: Primora can interact with web APIs and automate web tasks.

docs.title: Fetching Data
docs.text:
fetch url("https://api.example.com/data") as data
echo data

docs.title: Automation
docs.text: automate "click" on "#submit-button"

docs.title: Email
docs.text:
email to user@example.com subject "Hello" body "This is a test."

Next: Data Science or Dictionary

docs.title: Primora Guides and Tutorials
docs.text: Welcome to the hands-on section! Here you'll find step-by-step guides and tutorials for learning and mastering Primora.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Beginner Tutorials
  • Intermediate Guides
  • Advanced Tutorials
  • FAQ

For a complete reference, see the Dictionary or Book.

docs.title: Automation
docs.text: automate "click" on "#button"

docs.title: Custom Functions
docs.text:
def greet(name) {
    echo "Hello, " + name
}
greet("World")

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
try {
    risky()
} catch (e) {
    echo e
}

See the FAQ for more help.

docs.title: Hello, Primora!
docs.text: echo "Hello, Primora!"

docs.title: Variables and Output
docs.text:
x = 10
echo x

docs.title: Simple Math
docs.text:
a = 5
b = 3
echo a + b

Continue to Intermediate Guides

docs.title: What is Primora?
docs.text: A next-generation programming language for AI, automation, and rapid development.

docs.title: How do I run Primora code?
docs.text: Use the Primora Playground or set up locally.

docs.title: Can I use AI features?
docs.text: Yes! Use summarize, translate, predict, and more.

docs.title: How do I plot data?
docs.text: Use: plot data as "Title"

docs.title: How do I report a bug or contribute?
docs.text:
Open an issue or PR on GitHub.

See the Dictionary and Book for more.

docs.title: Using AI Features
docs.text:
summarize "Primora is awesome!" as summary
echo summary

docs.title: Working with Data
docs.text:
fetch url("https://api.example.com/data") as data
echo data

docs.title: Plotting
docs.text:
plot data as "Plot Title"

Continue to Advanced Tutorials
